revised_title: Haploid Manipulation in Plant Breeding: Applications and Advancements
tldr: This article discusses the manipulation of genetic systems in plant breeding through haploidy, focusing on the potential of haploids in producing fully homozygous lines, improving the efficiency of selection, and creating inbred lines for hybrid varieties. The author explains various methods of inducing haploids, such as in vivo and in vitro techniques, and their applications in different types of crops, including self-pollinated and cross-pollinated diploids.
